solution.text:
Volume of the cylindrical wire = volume of the sphere
Now volume of the cylinder\(=[\pi \times r^2\times l]\), let the radius of the cylinder= r and \(l\)=_{{27*j}}_
\(\Rightarrow \frac {22}7 \times r^2 \times _{{27*j}}_\)
volume of the sphere \(=[\frac 43 \times \pi \times R^3]\)
radius of the sphere= _{j}_
volume of the sphere\(= [ \frac 43 \times \frac {22}7 \times _{j}_^3]\)
therefore on equating we get, \([ \frac 43 \times \frac {22}7 \times _{j}_^3]=\frac {22}7 \times r^2 \times _{{27*j}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow r=_{{trunc(Decimal('2')*j/9,2)}}_ \Rightarrow thickness=2\times r=_{{trunc(Decimal('4')*j/9,2)}}_\)

content.text: Find the thickness of the _{{27*j}}_cm cylindrical wire drawn from a sphere of radius(R)=_{j}_cm
